cards.text: domino 2 prototype
this is not yet a fully functional alternative to domino 1
this is a sounding board for changes to the domino format and interface
any feedback, however obvious, even if already mentioned here, will help me prioritise so please speak your mind
please report any bugs you find so that i can make sure this prototype is representative of my intentions for domino
board layout
the driving change for this version is adding more flexibility to the layout of cards on the board
cards now sit on a square grid, with the standard card size occupying 2x2 squares
it is therefore now possible to mix the original hex arrangement with horizontal rows, table layouts etc
this incidentally matches how i draw domino-like things in my notebook at 4x4 boxes on squared paper
cards can be resized beyond the base size in increments of 1 cell (half a card)
this allows for longer passages of text without trying to conscientiously lay the cards out in a set reading order
it also allows for larger image cards and image cards with different aspect ratios

the hex grid came from trying to maximise the number of possibly adjacent cards so cards could be associated by proximity

but it has remained quite difficult to both put related ideas together and to clearly seperate unrelated cards
cards can be grouped to create a coloured bounding background to more clearly visually associate them
i haven't quite figured out the best way to use them--especially how sparingly..
they also provide a convient means to save selections for later so dragging multiple cards can be easier
cards can be linked by lines between them, a frequently requested feature
i didn't bother with this feature for domino 1 because it would be effort and in my experience line connections get very messy
however i can see it being a useful way to provide a linear reading order for some cards
and maybe a nice way to break out more detail from an already dense part of the board
i had planned to introduce a kind of pop-out document for longer text, but keeping things either directly on the board or leaving them to be another document that's hyperlinked feels cleaner
discarded features
there are some domino 1 features i have no intention of carrying over. let me know if you would miss them
dragging images from other tabs/windows is dropped in favour of just either pasting or using the file picker
pasting images will no longer add the source url as a link on the card
i won't encourage editing using exported boards instead of the main release--i'll pursue that idea in a different project
workflow improvements
you can now save in-browser instead of exporting html
locating which domino copy you made your in-browser save in would be very annoying
another important focus of domino 2 is improving the workflow, particularly making it less annoying to work iteratively on a single board over a longer period of time
the intended workflow is now editing in a single copy of domino rather than using the existing export to edit itself
exporting and downloading the board just to save and avoid losing data accidentally was very annoying
you can drag multiple cards now by selecting them first
card dragging is more direct and there is a shadow to indicate where the card will end up when you drop it
you can no longer make two cards swap places by dragging one of top of the other
i would have done these in domino 1 except coordinate transform stuff was confusing me too much
you can now zoom in and out freely instead of being confined to two levels
card buttons can no longer jump to spatial coordinates--instead you jump to specific cards
it's very annoying to have to redo all the buttons because you rearranged the cards
i find myself accidentally dragging multiple cards because i didn't realise i was in a selection though...
you can no longer create or delete cards by dragging from/to an icon on the toolbar
mobile
this prototype does not support mobile and i'm not sure to what extent i should support mobile
i should support viewing on mobile--the main thing missing here is touch controls for zooming
i don't know if anyone is actually using domino on mobile or even if anyone would want to
i've avoided right-click / modifier keys so far in case i do want to support editing on mobile
possible
missing
things that didn't make it into in this prototype but should definitely be added before release
way to duplicate cards
domino 1 style card styles in addition to css editing
import a previously exported project
not sure if this will be problematic with the domino documentation being a domino board itself..
there's no help/about menu
clear board to blank
i don't like the interface for linking cards but i don't have many better ideas
hotkeys for navigation and editing
button to create new card (it's just double click right now)
peripheral new features that i am considering implementing in the near future
allow running javascript from card buttons, support showing/hiding cards interactively this way
slightly better editor for custom css (edit card template styles independently, color picker, image to datauri)
emoji picker? support for custom icons for card buttons?
toolbar for saving bookmarks to cards? both for editing and navigation
way to pick specific group and link colors
more control over compression of images in image cards
undo/redo
font importing
mobile touch support

i'm strongly considering replacing the card editor window with a sidebar (similar to the project menu in domino 1)

the current placement is so the text editor is pretty close to the card you're editing but i think maybe just a larger edit area to the side is better?

properties.custom-css: .card-body { line-height: 1.35em; background-image: linear-gradient(gainsboro 1px, transparent 1px), linear-gradient(90deg, gainsboro 1px, transparent 1px); background-size: 1.3em 1.3em; background-position: .75em .75em; }
